page.title: 17CHEDWORTH MANOR.
page.content: Chedworth manor lies south of the church. The Normans normally built the manor an arrow shot away from the church tower,to act as an administative body of the village.The manor was originally a farm_house sited on a natural spring of water. In Victorian times it was possible to pump water farther up the hill to the new farm buildings.There is a Tithe barn across the lawn as big as the chancel of the church.The Tithe was a kind of tax it was one tenth of a mans earnings. In 1485 Chedworth church was rebuilt,the fine windows were probably paid for by the money that was coming from the wool trade.The Black Death had killed so many people that there were few left to work the land. by JULIA NICHOLAS AND SARAH CARTER
